title: Was Donald Trump's grandfather a legal immigrant? How did his grandfather become a US citizen? - Quora

response.answer_text: At the time immigration was not illegal. Fredric Trump came to America in 1885. At the time the only people automatically excluded were Chinese and Germans could and go as they pleased. After living in America for a certain number of years they could also automatically be granted citizenship… if they were white. In fact “illegal immigration” as we now think of it is a fairly modern invention. Prior to WWI people could travel as freely as they wished. By WWII many countries, America in particular, had become xenophobic and isolationist.
It looks like his immigration was legal but his emmigration was not. Apparently he was trying to avoid being drafted.
